instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_CPU: What is PPVCORE_S0_CPU? This is the primary power rail for the CPU that powers the CPU, known as CPU vcore. Without this, the machine will be braindead. .
definitions.CPUIMVP_VR_ON: What is CPUIMVP_VR_ON? CPUIMVP_VR_ON is a signal that tells the buck converter responsible for PPVCORE_S0_CPU to turn on and create CPU vcore voltage. This comes from ALL_SYS_PWRGD â€“ once ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present, CPUIMVP_VR_ON will be present. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Hello, I have <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>
<SIGNAL>CPUIMVP_VR_ON</SIGNAL> 3.3v
<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> diode 0.09v
already replaced <CHIP>U7400</CHIP>

what to try next?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Do you get all voltages from pages 69/70?

Any history available?

Try known good BIOS too...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> NO <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
all voltages from pages 69/70 are present
I tried known good BIOS
no history available, but I found a ripped off component
